adrFormatAddress: 61 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Extensive amount of coffee choices here! The ambiance inside is really nice, although it can be a bit crowded. It's nice to sit down and chill out. It's clean and modern inside. I ordered a Raspberry Cheesecake and it was alright... a little dry and crumbly. I don't think it's worth the price, so you can probably skip this and just get some coffee instead!

originalText.text: Such a neat place to eat and have drinks! Very spacious. Comfy and cozy. Cocktails up top, coffee downstairs. Bathrooms were a little weird being unisex restrooms but besides that it was a great experience! Drinks were tasty!

text.text: Such a neat place to eat and have drinks! Very spacious. Comfy and cozy. Cocktails up top, coffee downstairs. Bathrooms were a little weird being unisex restrooms but besides that it was a great experience! Drinks were tasty!

originalText.text:
I've been to the reverse Roastery Seattle and Chicago, first time in New York City location. I must say in terms of space is smaller then the rest, but still keeps the same essence and accessibility.
The ambience is incredible pleasant, from having a quick bite, enjoy your coffee with a view and a nice conversation.
the tall windows wall makes the natural light brings up the space to a more airy feeling.

It has two levels, a basement level bar, darker and more intimate , regular level, and a mezzanine level where the the bar is.
Bar doesn't open until 11 am I believe, but in the meantime there's enough to entertain yourself.

Service is quick, unless it gets very busy, you might have to wait a second to get your order ready.
It has 3 different service area including the basement part.
The staff is very proactive and professional.

originalText.text:
I don't know if it's just me, but walking in here is really disorienting. There's just so many things going on and all over the place that it's difficult to really understand where to go. There are multiple counters and baristas, a downstairs, and an upstairs, and not a lot of signs that actually tell you what things are. The prices are also on the high side, but that's to be expected at a Starbucks Reserve location. Also, it's worth noting that seating is available, but not plentiful. I went at 10 PM on a Friday night and there were only a few open so I'd imagine that it's typically very packed during normal business hours.

The restroom deserves a section on its own. It's a gender neutral walk in restroom with different stalls built into the actual walls and sort of in a rectangular shape. Some of the doors are push and some are pull for some reason, but overall, it was a very good-looking and pristine restroom. Unfortunately, others also took more than a few seconds to comprehend the unique restroom design and I had to help a man and an elderly woman figure it out. The doors to open each stall were also heavy so some people thought they were in use, but didn't realize they just needed to pull harder.

Anyways, I'm still rating 5 stars because the strawberry croissant was really good and obviously this is a unique location with a unique experience. I'm sure coffee and Starbucks lovers will enjoy it a lot more.

originalText.text:
Such a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Very interesting brew methods to try! I recommend you go to the lower level bar and ask for a siphon coffee! I've never seen a brew method like this before!

This place is also nice to go and relax for a couple hours by the fire, eating a pizza or pastry they make in house.

Promise you've never been to a Starbucks like this before!
